content.description:
You can stand start dry using the worn out stairs along the side of the large side of the diversion to attempt this climb if the water level is low enough. There is no easy way to have a spotter on this one so the half water half concrete landing makes it a bit of a sketchy climb. Using small crimps and strange foot jams you can make you way up this climb with only a small amount of fear. Exercise caution if you are going to attempt this climb, it's an easy one to fall poorly on.

Do not attempt when water flow is high! Summer time is best for this climb.
content.location: "Fuck It" the counter part to "Damn It" is apart of the west side of the diversion dam. People are often jumping off and hanging out on this part so watch for swimmers and the occasional kid jumping from one side of the diversion to the other.

content.description:
Fun climb out of the water up the tracts of the old diversion dam door that used to be there. Good hold requiring some fun body positioning, Crux is the mantel at the top. V2 with wet feet and no shoes. PG-13 because of the narrow fall into the water and lack of spotting that can be done to avoid some of the underwater rocks.

Do not attempt this climb in the winter when the water flows are high. Summer is best.
content.location: As you walk from the trail onto the diversion the climb is on the obvious old tracts of the dam on the east side of the river (or the structure on the other side of the water flow from you).
